library(refugees)

library(unhcrthemes)
library(scales)
library(popdata)
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)

lapply(my_files, load, .GlobalEnv)

MyRegion <- "Asia"
MyYear <- 2023

# Plot1


region_total <- POC(MYSR(MyYear),region_d,MyYear)
totalPoC <- round(as.numeric(region_total[which(region_total$region_d == MyRegion),"POC_Total"])/1e6,1)

totalFD <- round(as.numeric(region_total[which(region_total$region_d == MyRegion),"Forcibly_Displaced"])/1e6,1)

totalref_region <- round(as.numeric(Plot2[which(Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023'  & Plot2$pop_type == 'Refugees and Refugee-like'),"pop_figure"])/1e6,1) + round(as.numeric(Plot2[which(Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023'  & Plot2$pop_type == 'Asylum-Seekers'),"pop_figure"])/1e6,1)

totalidp_region <- round(as.numeric(Plot2[which(Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023'  & Plot2$pop_type == 'IDPs'),"pop_figure"])/1e6,1)

totalsta_region <- round(as.numeric(Plot2[which(Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023'  & Plot2$pop_type == 'Stateless'),"pop_figure"])/1e6,1)

decade_change <- round(as.numeric((Plot1_label[10,2] - Plot1_label[1,2])*100/Plot1_label[1,2]))

## Trends in Last Decade

::: columns
::: {.column width="80%"}


```{r}

gg <- ggplot(Plot1) +
  geom_col(aes(x = year,
               y = pop_mil,
               fill = pop_type),
           width = 0.7)  +
  scale_fill_unhcr_d(palette = "pal_unhcr_poc",
                     nmax = 9,
                     order = c(8,6,9,5,4,1))+
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = pretty_breaks(n = 6), 
                     limits = c(0,14.5),
                     expand = expansion(c(0, 0.2)))+
  labs(title = paste0("People UNHCR protects and/or assists in the ",plot_title_region, " Region | ", MyYear - 9," - mid_", MyYear),
       y = "Number of people (million)")+
  theme_unhcr(grid = FALSE,
              axis_title = "y")

gg + geom_text(size = 9,
               data = Plot1_label, 
               aes(x = year, y = total_poc, label = round(total_poc, 1)), 
               vjust = -0.5) + 
  theme(text = element_text(size = 18)) 

```
:::

::: {.column style="width: 20%; font-size: 40%;"}
<br><br> - The total population UNHCR protects and/or assists in `r plot_title_region` remains at **`r totalPoC`M** by mid-2023, the highest number on record according to available data. <br> <br> - This is a **`r decade_change`% increase** compared to end-2014 figure from almost a decade ago.
:::
:::

## Population figures in Asia-Pacific

::: columns
::: {.column width="80%"}
```{r}
#| label: poc-2022-mysr2023
#| fig-align: left
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 6
ggplot(Plot2) +
  geom_col(aes(x = pop_figure, 
               y = fct_rev(reorder(pop_type, -pop_figure)), 
               fill = as.character(Year)), 
           position = position_dodge(0.7), width = 0.6)+
  geom_text(aes(
    x = pop_figure,
    y = fct_rev(reorder(pop_type, -pop_figure)),
    group = as.character(Year),
    label = scales::comma(round(pop_figure,-2))),
    position = position_dodge(width = 0.7),
    hjust = -0.05, size = 6.5) +
  scale_fill_unhcr_d(palette = "pal_unhcr") +
  labs(title = paste0("Population Categories in ", plot_title_region, " | ", MyYear-1, " - mid_", MyYear),
       caption = "Note: Stateless persons have been included in both stateless and their respective displacement categories\nSource: UNHCR Refugee Data Finder\n© UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency") +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(c(0, 0.1))) +
  scale_y_discrete(labels = scales::label_wrap(17)) +
  theme_unhcr(grid = FALSE, axis = "y", axis_title = FALSE, axis_text = "y") +
  theme(text = element_text(size = 18)) 

# Plot2
fd_change <- round((sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023' & Plot2$pop_type %in% c('Refugees and Refugee-like', 'Asylum-Seekers', 'IDPs')])  -  sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 2022 & Plot2$pop_type %in% c('Refugees and Refugee-like', 'Asylum-Seekers', 'IDPs')]))*100 / sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 2022 & Plot2$pop_type %in% c('Refugees and Refugee-like', 'Asylum-Seekers', 'IDPs')]),1)

ref_asy_change <- round((sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023' & Plot2$pop_type %in% c('Refugees and Refugee-like', 'Asylum-Seekers')])  -  sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 2022 & Plot2$pop_type %in% c('Refugees and Refugee-like', 'Asylum-Seekers')]))*100 / sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 2022 & Plot2$pop_type %in% c('Refugees and Refugee-like', 'Asylum-Seekers')]),0)

ref_asy_previous <- round((sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == '2022' & Plot2$pop_type %in% c('Refugees and Refugee-like', 'Asylum-Seekers')]))/1e6,1)

ref_asy_new <- round((sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023' & Plot2$pop_type %in% c('Refugees and Refugee-like', 'Asylum-Seekers')]))/1e6,1)

idp_change <- round((sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023' & Plot2$pop_type == 'IDPs'])  -  sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 2022 & Plot2$pop_type == 'IDPs']))*100 / sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 2022 & Plot2$pop_type == 'IDPs']),0)

idp_previous <- round((sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == '2022' & Plot2$pop_type == 'IDPs']))/1e6,1)

idp_new <- round((sum(Plot2$pop_figure[Plot2$Year == 'mid_2023' & Plot2$pop_type == 'IDPs']))/1e6,1)
```
:::

::: {.column style="width: 20%; font-size: 40%;"}
<br><br><br> - **`r fd_change`% increase** in the total number of forcibly displaced people compared to end-2022 <br> <br> - Refugees (including people in refugee-like situation) and asylum-seekers increased by `r ref_asy_change`% from `r ref_asy_previous`M to `r ref_asy_new`M <br> <br> - IDPs increased to `r idp_new`M, a **`r idp_change`% increase** from `r idp_previous`M at end-2022
:::
:::

# Refugees & People in Refugee-like Situations {.slide-blue}

## Refugees from `r plot_title_region` 

::: columns
::: {.column width="80%"}
```{r}
#| label: refugees-coo
#| fig-align: left
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 6

ggplot(Plot3) +
  geom_col(aes(x = ref_figure,
               y = reorder(originCountry, ref_figure),
               fill = pop_type), width = 0.7) +
  geom_text(data = filter(Plot3, ref_figure > 40000),
            aes(x = ref_figure,
                y = reorder(originCountry, ref_figure),
                group = pop_type,
                label = round(ref_figure / 1e6, 2)),
            position = position_stack(vjust = 0.75), size = 6) +
  labs(title = paste0("Refugees and people in refugee-like situations from ",  plot_title_region, " | mid_", MyYear),
       subtitle = "Number of people (millions)",
       caption = "Source: UNHCR Refugee Data Finder\n© UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency") +
  scale_x_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0, 0.1))) +
  scale_fill_unhcr_d(palette = "pal_unhcr",
                     nmax = 10,
                     order = c(2, 1)) +
  theme_unhcr(grid = FALSE, axis = "y", axis_title = FALSE, axis_text = "y") + theme(text = element_text(size = 20)) + theme(plot.subtitle=element_text(size=18))

#Plot3

afg_ref_data <- MYSR(MyYear) %>% mutate(asylum = replace(asylum, asylum %in% c("CHI", "HKG", "MAC"),"CHI")) %>% filter(origin == 'AFG' & Refugees > 0)

afg_hosting_count <- as.numeric(length(unique(afg_ref_data$asylum)))

totalAFG_ref <- round((sum(Plot3$ref_figure[Plot3$originCountry == 'Afghanistan']))/1e6,1)

totalMYA_ref <- round((sum(Plot3$ref_figure[Plot3$originCountry == 'Myanmar']))/1e6,2)

mya_ref <- MYSR(MyYear) %>% filter(origin == 'MYA' & Refugees > 0)
mya_ref_asia <- MYSR(MyYear) %>% filter(origin == 'MYA' & Refugees > 0 & region_d == 'Asia')
mya_ref_asia_percent <- round((sum(mya_ref_asia$Refugees)/sum(mya_ref$Refugees))*100,1)

```
:::

::: {.column style="width: 20%; font-size: 38%;"}
<br><br>-Afghanistan overtook Ukraine to become the second largest country of origin of refugees (including refugee-like) globally, with `r totalAFG_ref` million hosted by `r afg_hosting_count` countries and territories globally. <br><br>-Myanmar is the second largest country of origin of refugees (including refugee-like) in and the sixth largest globally. There are `r totalMYA_ref` million refugees and people in refugee-like situations from Myanmar. The vast majority (`r mya_ref_asia_percent`%) are hosted within the region, with over three-quarters hosted in Bangladesh.
:::
:::

## SDG 10.7.4

::: columns
::: {.column width="75%"}
```{r}
#| label: refugees-coo-sdg
#| fig-align: left
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 6

ggplot(Plot4) + 
  geom_col(aes(x = reorder(country, sdg), y = sdg),
           fill = unhcr_pal(n=1, "pal_blue"))+
  coord_flip()+
  labs(title = paste0("Sustainable Development Goals indicator 10.7.4 | mid_", MyYear),
       x = "Countries" , y = "SDG Indicator 10.7.4") +
  geom_text(aes(x = country, 
                y = sdg, 
                label = scales::comma(sdg), 
                hjust = -0.1), size = 7)+
  scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0,0.1)))+
  theme_unhcr(grid = FALSE,
              axis = "y",
              axis_title = FALSE,
              axis_text = "y") + theme(text = element_text(size=20))

sdg1_ctry <- Plot4$country[1]
sdg1_value <- format(as.numeric(Plot4$sdg[1]), big.mark = ",")

sdg2_ctry <- Plot4$country[2]
sdg2_value <- format(as.numeric(Plot4$sdg[2]), big.mark = ",")

sdg3_ctry <- Plot4$country[3]
sdg3_value <- format(as.numeric(Plot4$sdg[3]), big.mark = ",")

sdg4_ctry <- Plot4$country[4]
sdg4_value <- format(as.numeric(Plot4$sdg[4]), big.mark = ",")

sdg5_value <- format(as.numeric(Plot4$sdg[5]), big.mark = ",")

```
:::

::: {.column style="width: 25%; font-size: 38%;"}
<br>-SDG indicator 10.7.4 is a useful way to identify the countries of origin with the most refugees relative to their number of inhabitants.
<br><br>-The countries that have seen the greatest proportion of their national population becoming refugees are `r sdg1_ctry` (`r sdg1_value` per 100,000 inhabitants), `r sdg2_ctry` (`r sdg2_value` per 100,000), `r sdg3_ctry` (`r sdg3_value` per 100,000), `r sdg4_ctry` (`r sdg4_value` per 100,000) and `r sdg5_ctry` (`r sdg5_value` per 100,000). 
:::
:::

```
:::

::: {.column style="width: 30%; font-size: 35%;"}
<br><br><br><br>Given capacity constraints and limited protection value for refugee recognition, Pakistan does not conduct RSD for all asylum seekers, other than for those where there may be a protection dividend such as resettlement.<br><br>In Malaysia, the strategic use of Refugee Status Determination (RSD) is utilized. As a result, some asylum seekers from populations with a high presumption of eligibility are provided with UNHCR card/documentation, but a decision may never be issued owing to a lack of any additional protection value in conducting mandate RSD. Those cases that are identified for resettlement needs would have to undergo a mandate RSD, however.
:::
:::

       caption = "Source: UNHCR Refugee Data Finder\n© UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency") +
  scale_x_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0, 0.1))) +
  theme_unhcr(grid = FALSE,
              axis = "y",
              axis_title = FALSE,
              axis_text = "y")+
  guides(fill="none") + theme(text = element_text(size = 25)) + theme(plot.subtitle=element_text(size=18))
```
